business-schedule.title: Business to be taken in European Committees
business-schedule.division-heading: Business to be taken in European Committees
business-schedule.division-note: The following list consists of European Union Documents to be considered in European Committees. The dates appointed for consideration are provisional.

european-committee-motion.motion-text: That the Committee takes note of an unnumbered explanatory memorandum from HM Treasury dated 2 December 2009 on the European Court of Auditors’ 2008 Annual Report, an unnumbered Explanatory Memorandum from the Department for International Development dated 3 December 2009 on the European Court of Auditors Annual Report on the activities funded by the seventh, eighth, ninth and tenth European Development Funds, concerning the financial year 2008, European Union Document No. 12139/09 and Addenda 1 and 2 on the Protection of the financial interests of the Communities, an unnumbered Explanatory Memorandum from HM Treasury dated 18 August 2009 on the European Anti-Fraud Office’s ninth activity report for the period 1 January to 31 December 2008, European Union Document No. 12668/09 and Addendum 1, Commission Report on the Annual report to the discharge authority on internal audits carried out in 2008, European Union Document No. 14998/09 and Addendum 1, a Commission Report to the European Parliament on the follow-up to 2007 Discharge Decisions (Summary)–European Parliament Resolutions, European Union Document No. 16632/09, European Court of Auditors Special Report on delegating implementing tasks to executive agencies, European Union Document No. 17588/09, Commission Report to the Council on the follow-up to 2007 Discharge Decisions (Summary)–Council recommendations; and supports the Government’s promotion of measures to improve the level of assurance given on the Community budget. [29th Report of Session 2008-09, HC 19-xxvii, Chapter 2, 3rd Report of Session 2009-10, HC 5-iii, Chapter 2, 4th Report of Session 2009-10, HC 5-iv, Chapter 1 and Chapter 2, 5th Report of Session 2009-10, HC 5-v, Chapter 1, and 7th Report of Session 2009-10, HC 7-vi, Chapter 1].

european-committee-motion.scheduled: To be considered at 4.30 pm on 1 February 2010.
european-committee-motion.motion-text: That the Committee takes note of European Union Document No. 14513/09, Commission Communication on Enlargement Strategy and Main Challenges 2009-10; and supports the Government’s policy that Turkey, Croatia, Iceland and all the countries of the Western Balkans should be able to join the EU when they meet the criteria. [33rd Report of Session 2008-09, HC 19-xxxi, Chapter 2].
european-committee-motion.motion-note: The European Scrutiny Committee has also designated the following document as relevant to the debate:

european-committee-motion.scheduled: To be considered at 4.30 pm on 26 January 2010.
european-committee-motion.item-heading: 3 MUTUAL LEGAL ASSISTANCE IN CRIMINAL MATTERS BETWEEN THE EU AND JAPAN
european-committee-motion.motion-text: That the Committee takes note of European Union Document No. 17708/09, relating to a proposal for a Council Decision on the conclusion of the Agreement between the European Union and Japan on Mutual Legal Assistance in criminal matters (MLA); and supports the EU Council decision to conclude the Agreement in order to establish a formal international framework for MLA between the EU and Japan which will improve the measures available to combat international and transnational crime. [2nd Report of Session 2009-10, HC 5-ii, Chapter 2.]

european-committee-motion.scheduled: To be considered at 4.30 pm on 2 February 2010.
european-committee-motion.motion-text: European Union Document No. 15049/09 and Addenda 1 to 3 were referred to European Committee B on 9 December 2009 by the European Scrutiny Committee [3rd Report of Session 2009-10, HC 5-iii, Chapter 3].

european-committee-motion.scheduled: Date and time of consideration to be arranged.
european-committee-motion.item-heading: 5 FUTURE RELATIONS BETWEEN THE EU AND THE OVERSEAS COUNTRIES AND TERRITORIES
european-committee-motion.motion-text: European Union Document No. 15647/09 was referred to European Committee B on 9 December 2009 by the European Scrutiny Committee [3rd Report of Session 2009-10, HC 5-iii, Chapter 1].

european-committee-motion.scheduled: To be considered at 4.30 pm on 9 February 2010.
european-committee-motion.item-heading: 6 EUROPEAN DEFENCE AGENCY THREE YEAR FINANCIAL FRAMEWORK POSTPONEMENT AND 2010 BUDGET ADOPTION
european-committee-motion.motion-text: European Union Documents Nos. 16275/09 and 16462/09 and an Unnumbered Explanatory Memorandum dated 3 December 2009, submitted by the Ministry of Defence, were referred to European Committee B on 15 December 2009 by the European Scrutiny Committee [4th Report of Session 2009-10, HC 5-iv, Chapter 3].

european-committee-motion.scheduled: Date and time of consideration to be arranged.
european-committee-motion.motion-text: An Unnumbered Explanatory Memorandum dated 2 December 2009 submitted by the Home Department relating to the Green Paper from the Commission of the European Communities on obtaining evidence in criminal matters from one member State to another, European Union Document No. 17691/09, was referred to European Committee B on 6 January 2010 by the European Scrutiny Committee [5th Report of Session 2009-10, HC 5-v, Chapter 2].

european-committee-motion.scheduled: To be considered at 4.30 pm on 8 February 2010.
european-committee-motion.motion-text: European Union Documents No. 9494/09 and Addenda 1 and 2 and No. 15162/09 were referred to European Committee B on 13 January 2010 by the European Scrutiny Committee [7th Report of Session 2009-10, HC 5-vi, Chapter 2].

european-committee-motion.scheduled: Date and time of consideration to be arranged.
european-committee-motion.motion-text: An Unnumbered Explanatory Memorandum dated 19 January 2010 submitted by the Foreign and Commonwealth Office relating to a Council Decision on a European Union military mission to contribute to the training of Somali Security Forces was referred to European Committee B on 20 January 2010 by the European Scrutiny Committee [8th Report of Session 2009-10, HC 5-vii].

european-committee-motion.scheduled: Date and time of consideration to be arranged.
